FacilityName: Tyson Fresh Meats, inc.  Dakota City, NE

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EPA RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

TYSON FRESH MEATS, Inc.     DAKOTA CITY, NE.

1. Accident Release Prevention Program and Emergency Response Policy

It is the policy of the TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC., Dakota City, Nebraska facility management to implement the requirements of this Risk Management Program (RMP) in accordance with the USEPA regulations under 40 CFR Part 68 and with the corresponding regulations under OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) program.  The objective is to minimize the risk of a release of a hazardous material and if a release occurs, to minimize the potential impact to TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC employees, the public and the environment.  This objective will be accomplished by utilizing general good operating procedures, providing appropriate training to all employees, and coordinating response activities, as necessary, with the local emergency response providers.  This plan covers all TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC owned activities at this facility.

TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC.'s management is committed to providing the resources necessary to implement this policy.

2. Facility Description

TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC operates a cattle slaughter and processing facility, and a hides tannery at this location.  Cattle are trucked to the facility, slaughtered and fabricated.  TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC. operates rendering systems to produce gel bone, dried blood, low protein beef byproducts, tallow, and other rendered products.  Support operations include a wastewater treatment system, truck repair facilities, cold storage, an analytical laboratory, and administrative offices.

Four chemicals are utilized or generated at the facility in sufficient quantities to be subject to the requirements of 40 CFR Part 68.  These chemicals are chlorine (in two separate processes), ammonia (in two separate processes), methane and hydrogen sulfide.  Chlorine is used as a disinfectant to treat water and wastewater; ammonia is used as a refrigerant throughout the facility; m

ethane and hydrogen sulfide are generated as an off-gas from the anaerobic lagoons at the wastewater treatment plant.


3. General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

The Dakota City, Nebraska facility is governed by a set of OSHA and USEPA regulations that require planning and facility activities intended to prevent a release of hazardous material, or if a release inadvertently occurs, to minimize the consequences of a release to the employees of the facility, the public and to the environment.  These regulations include:

* 40 CFR Part 68, Accidental Release Prevention

* 40 CFR Part 112, Spill Prevention, Control and Countermeasure

* 40 CFR Part 264, Hazardous Waste Contingency Plan

* 29 CFR Part 119, Process Safety Management

* 40 CFR Part 302, Emergency Planning and Community Right-to-Know Act (EPCRA)

The key concepts in TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC's release prevention program are employee participation, appropriate design and maintenance of equipment, and appropriate training of all employees.  TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC has developed and documented these elements in their process safety management plan (PSM).  The PSM plan is incorporated with this document by reference.

Employee participation in the release prevention program is encouraged and supported by TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC management.  Key personnel are responsible for conducting and implementing the findings from the Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) for the ammonia and chlorine systems, and for conducting the process safety review for the biogas (methane & hydrogen sulfide) system.  TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC employees are also members of the facility emergency response team.

TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC policy is to construct all new equipment, systems, and facilities to ensure the appropriate safety and release prevention systems are included from the beginning of each project.  TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC maintains a computerized program of maintenance activities to ensure that

key systems are maintained appropriately to minimize the risk of a release.

TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC is committed to providing appropriate training to all employees regarding safety procedures.  Each new employee is provided comprehensive safety training during their initial orientation for the facility.  In addition, TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC conducts regularly scheduled safety training for all employees each year.  Additional training is provided to maintenance personnel for the systems they are responsible for.  Members of TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC's emergency response team receive semiannual training to ensure that response actions are promptly and safely completed.

4. Five Year Accident History

Tyson Fresh Meats, Inc has had one accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years from the Dakota City, Nebraska facility. The release was 1,150 pounds. There were two employees taken to the hospital for observation and then released. No one off site was injured, and no personnel outside the facility were evacuated.  The Dakota City, Nebraska Waste Water Treatment Plant has had one accidental release of Biogas.  The release was <10 pounds. One contractor was taken to the hospital, treated and released. No one off site was injured, and no persons outside the facility were evacuated.  The Dakota City, Nebraska facility has not had a release of chlorine that has affected the public or environment or injured any employees on site within the past five years.

5. Emergency Response Program

Emergency Contact information is split based on the Hides/Tannery/Waste Water Treatment Plant business at Dakota City and on the Dakota City Complex business.

Emergency Contact for the Hides/Tannery/WWTP is Dale Masters.  Dale's job title is Plant Training & Safety Coordinator DC Hides/Tannery, work phone is (605) 235-2565, 24hr contact is through the Security Officer at (605) 235-2910, e-mail address is dale.masters@tyson.com.

Emergency Contact for the DC Complex is Fred Brau

n.  Fred's job title is also Plant Training & Safety Coordinator DC Plant, work phone is (605) 235-2578, 24hr contact is through the Security Officer at (605) 235-2910; e-mail address is Fred.Braun@tyson.com.

TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC has personnel trained in emergency response at the facility 24 hours per day, seven days per week.  These personnel receive semiannual training on emergency procedures and response techniques.

TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC does not have emergency response capability on site to respond to a methane emergency. It is TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC's policy to contact off-site emergency responders for assistance in the event of an accidental release of methane.

TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC's employees will attempt to extinguish small fires with fire extinguishers if they have been properly trained.  TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC's employees, trained in the safe operation of the methane system, will close manual shutoff valves to terminate the flow of methane if the valves can be safely approached.  For all other scenarios, TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC's employees will evacuate the area and allow off-site responders to respond to the emergency.

TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC has met with the local fire department to review the biogas (methane & hydrogen sulfide), chlorine and ammonia systems annually to review coordination and communication procedures.

6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety

TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC completes a thorough review of the ammonia systems, chlorine systems, and the biogas flare system each time a design change is implemented.  TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC is committed to using these methods to identify and implement ways to improve the safety of these systems.
